citation.article-title: Phylogenetic positions of phytoplasmas associated with dieback, yellow crinkle and mosaic diseases of papaya, and their proposed inclusion in 'Candidatus Phytoplasma australiense' and a new taxon, 'Candidatus Phytoplasma australasia'.

p.s: Description of Phytoplasma australasia sp. nov.

'Candidatus Phytoplasma australasia' [(Mollicutes) NC; NA; 0; NAS (EMBL Y 10097), oligonucleotide sequences of unique regions of the 16s rRNA gene 5'-TAAAAGGCATCTTTTATC-3' and 5'-CAAGGAAGAAAAGCAAATGGCGAACCATTTGTTT-3'; P (Carica papaya, Lycopersicon esculentum, phloem) ; MI. Although strains PnWB, SPWB, SUNHP and SPLL from subclade iii have minor variations in sequence regions that are unique to strains in 'Candidatus Phytoplasma australasia' (PpYC, PpM and TBB), we suggest that they be provisionally included in this taxon because of the close phylogenetic relationships of all these strains (Fig. 1) and their distinct geographic range from South-East Asia to Australia.
